runs.comm: full outside off, slapped on the drive... to short extra cover... who drops it! Straight in and out of JP Duminy's hands! The crowd lets out a big sigh, it went quickly to him but he didn't have to move, couldn't hold it
he responds with a shorter ball, but it's better directed, over middle and off and AB has to be careful he doesn't topple into his stumps as he sways out of the line
full, down the leg side, that's a wide
splice-jarring length, Roy tries to flip it to leg, the ball rolls back down the track
seaming past the outside edge as Roy goes for the booming drive again! Full and nibbling through to de Villiers, lovely bowling
pitched up and he gets a chunk of outside edge on it, flashes through gully for one to third man, Roy keeps the strike
back of a length, width for Roy to throw his hands through a cut, gets it between backward point and cover, won't quite go all the way
on the charge, tries to Babe Ruth one down the ground - beaten by the bounce, over the top of a horizontal blade
skips across and mistimes a drive into the covers
tight line around off stump, defended on a length
length outside off and Roy goes after him again, hits quite high on the bat as he goes over the top, won't quite make it all the way to long-off
full and straight, moves across and whips one to deep square leg - Roy just does not want to let his partner have a bat
back of a length and worked into a gap at midwicket
pace and bounce, back of a length and rising to hit the bat sticker as Hales prods at it
shortish, 142kph on the hips, worked away behind square off the padding

banged in, Roy pulls and misses... and would have lost his teeth, if he didn't have a helmet with a grille. Took it flush in the face, he seems okay, if a little stunned. Wanders around to compose himself before resuming
beauty! Rabada plucks out off stump! Nips back just enough at 146kph and removes the pole, beating Roy's wild attempted smear down down the ground. Roy is put out of his misery by the Gazelle of Doom
low full toss from Rabada, the field had been set for the short ball but Root wasn't to be bluffed, steered it wide of third man for four - that's England's first boundary
back of a length, past the outside edge as Hales wafts at it
gets this through a gap in the covers coming forward
shuffles into line and punches to extra cover on the bounce
short ball, climbs high as Hales swings across the line and fails to connect
at the body, worked into the leg side
Abbott drops short again, Root plays a forehand-smash-cum-hook and flaps it over midwicket and away for four
full and straight and scooped off his pads, high over midwicket but towards the sweeper on the bounce
drops back and steers the ball behind square, straight to backward point
slightly back of a length outside off, 141kph and guided a touch finer to third man
pow, right in the kisser! Hales unleashes the beast, picking up a fractionally short delivery from Rabada and hammering it several metres back over the square leg boundary
gets a slower ball wrong, sprayed down the leg side
full on off stump, 141kph and Hales uses the pace to bunt it back down the ground, Miller does well to dive across and cut it off from mid-on
top-edged for six! Root hooks and it flies down to fine leg, where Behadien takes a neat catch. Behardien's not in the XI and he was over the rope, but still
shortish and on the hip, Hales is hit on the pad trying to nudge to leg
straight line and worked away through backward square leg for one
good pace, 140kph on off stump, Root shows it a straight bat
slightly wider, goes back and steers through gully for a couple
Root advances, hits through the line... goes all the way! Root powers up like Super Mario and clubs Morris off a length over long-off
on the stumps and glanced through backward square leg
hitting the pitch hard, back of a length, Root works it to midwicket
short again, maybe a cutter, clipped off the back foot to the deep square leg fielder
length ball, 134kph and it pops off the deck, hits the shoulder of the bat to loop through gully
too straight from Wiese, a half-volley on the pads and Root nudges it fine to the boundary
comes walking out down the pitch, Wiese bangs it in and he adjusts to defend down into the off side
stays back on leg stump this time and Wiese errs again, full on the pads and whipped away through backward square for four more
tossed up on the stumps and worked through mid-on coming forwards
floated up outside off, leans out to drive down the ground
length ball on the stumps, Hales drops back and nurdles away to leg
flighted, driven back to the bowler

Root tries to land a blow on Immy... but only succeeds in knocking himself out! Goes for the big blow over extra cover but this hasn't got the requisite oomph to clear the boundary, lands with a plop in the hands of the man in the deep

nudged into the leg side for one, or is there two...? No, there's a run out instead! Hales wanted a second, Morgan started to come and then changed his mind, leaving Tahir plenty of time to take the throw from midwicket and gleefully smash the stumps
back of a length outside off, dabbed behind point
short, pushed across the left-hander, Morgan is surprised by the bounce as he reaches for it and steers in the air wide of slip
good carry in the channel outside off, Buttler leaves alone
comes forward to tap a length ball into the covers
short ball, strays leg side
woof, that's a decent nut from Morris, takes off from a length, past the bat as Buttler hung in the crease
another wide, slower ball bobbling down the leg side as Buttler advanced
short of a length, Buttler gets up on his toes and plinks a drive through mid-off for one
lashed through the covers, despite the shouts of catch! Aggressive start from Buttler, forcing a drive away
punched into the off side and du Plessis pounces on it, though they still get one
slightly short, outside off and poked to mid-off
Morgan nudges Tahir off his pads into a gap
shuffling into line, dabbed back past the bowler
tossed up and steered in front of square
pitched up and driven off the front foot through cover point
rolls his fingers over it, the lack of pace foxes Buttler as he plays across the line
beautiful hands from Buttler, drops back and stabs a drive through point, timed to the fence
pick that out! Buttler moves across and brutalises Wiese into the crowd at deep square leg! Immense power in that shot, from a ball that was only slightly short
full and driven, not out of the middle but into a gap
angled across, drops back and runs one to third man
tossed up on off stump and Morgan reverse-sweeps, in the air but lands safely... he then has to hurry to the opposite end as the throw comes in
on the full, worked off the legs for one
legbreak on the stumps, poked towards mid-on
nearly plays on! Morgan chops the ball down past his stumps, trying to force it away
flighted, possibly the googly and Morgan plays it uncertainly to backward point
drops back and dabs behind square, again can't get it through - just two off another tight over from Tahir

full outside off and Buttler toe-ends a drive into the ground through to the keeper. De Villiers reacted well to grab it - and they are now going to check that it was actually a bump ball. Which it was
nailed for four over extra cover! Wiese wasn't far from getting his yorker in but Buttler somehow managed to get under it and lather a drive over the infield and into a gap
full again, drilled along the ground past extra cover
skips out, clubs down the ground - and it sails beyond long-on! Didn't look as if he'd really got hold of it but the fielder on the fence was never in business
all the way again, through the thin Highveld air! Picked the slower ball and hoicked it from outside off over deep midwicket... Shades of Morgan's dazzling innings here in 2009
full toss and slapped just short of extra cover! A dot and some respite for Wiese
Buttler does a shimmy in the crease, makes room to slap one through point
tossed up full and worked off the pads
gives it some air, Buttler nearly swings himself off his feet, beaten by the legbreak... but his back foot was always in
makes room to mow one through the covers
floated up, googly outside off and Morgan chips through extra cover, there's a man in the deep but they get back for two - 50 stand between these two
down on knee, carted over long-on! Morgan didn't have any trouble with that delivery, the final one of Tahir's allocation, straight out of the middle and into the crowd
and there goes JP Duminy, right into the firing line! Buttler sets himself and creams the ball over long-on for a flat six
fired in full outside off and Buttler drills it back down the ground, excellent diving stop at long-on prevents four

goes wide, Buttler dances out... and demolishes this straight back down the ground! Wrecking ball blow, through the line, high into the stand - top tier! Buttler is teeing off, trying to land one in the golf course
whipped through the leg side, on the move again
darted through outside off as Morgan drops back, slaps to backward point
full and slightly wide, dipping to hit the toe as Morgan squeezes one behind point
pitched up outside off from over the wicket, chipped over cover for a couple
crashed over deep midwicket on the pull! Stand and deliver from Morgan, hits sweetly across the line, another beyond the ropes
driven down the ground, good fielding has them scrambling for one
full toss down the leg side... Buttler was walking ominously into line
steps to leg, Morris fires it wide on the off side - called again, though it was tight
steams in and hammers the middle of the pitch, flies through above Buttler's swing to leg
good yorker from Morris, 148kph on middle stump, still he manages to bottom-hand it down the ground, long-on has to run across and they get two
slower ball, cutter on off stump, Buttler miscues it... but somehow manages to get a thick inside edge through in front of square leg for another boundary
full in the blockhole, Morgan digs it out down the ground
Jiminy Cricket, that's gone! Buttler sees it big, keeps his head still and Rambos a pull off a length deep into the stands at wide long-on for his fifty, off 27 balls

makes room and slaps into the covers... only for du Plessis to snap it up just above the ground! They go upstairs to check it carried but Faf got his fingers under it and the Buttler rampage is over. Full toss from Abbott does the job

full and driven back down the ground - Abbott gets a finger on it, the stumps are razed and England have lost two in two balls again! A wicket followed by a run-out, although Morgan is unlucky this time, he was backing up and had no chance to react
pitched up and driven into the covers
length outside off, Billings whirls the arm through an attempted slap, misses

full and crunched back towards the bowler, Morris takes the catch - and SA are celebrating. Was it a bump ball? They are going to send it to the TV umpire but it looked a bump ball on first glance... No, the bat struck the ground, took the power out of it, the ball floated back off the toe and Morris grabbed it. Du Plessis was certain and his judgement was proved sound
Morris nails his yorker, middle and off and dug out back down the track
fired full outside off, reaches to stroke one through the covers
full length, Billings goes across to try and slog-sweep, maybe gets a bit of bat on it before hitting the front pad... he was outside the line of off anyway

clubbed over cover point, in the air... and Duminy swoops to take a blinder! He dropped a catch from the first ball of the match but he has made up for it with that, diving full length to make the grab inches above the ground. Moeen fails to launch again
has a big swing at a length ball in the channel and misses again
on the stumps and Jordan flips one into the leg side
full outside off, in the slot and Billings sends a rasping drive through the covers, there was no one out there and it races away
slower ball, full toss from Abbott and Billings swats it away to leg... He's wondering about the height but the umpires are satisfied is was not above the waist
Jordan tries to club down the ground... hit it straight in the air and du Plessis pulls of another smart catch running in from mid-off! Another for Abbott, England slide further

picks out square leg, two in two again! Abbott covers his eyes with his hands, it was a half-tracker that Billings could have hit anywhere but instead sends to practically the only man in the ring on the leg side, where Amla plucks it casually above his head
length on off stump, Topley defends stoically
slides down the leg side
short ball, Rashid miscues a swing to the leg side and it rolls in front of point
good length on the stumps, Topley defends to the leg side and sets off
short ball, swings across the line, huuuuuuuuuuuge top edge - but de Villiers won't get there running back and Rashid gets a couple

bowled him! Rabada finishes as he began by removing off stump! Ugly swipe from Rashid and he's beaten for pace, bringing to a close an ugly collapse that saw England go from 157 for 3 to 171 all out. From the sublime to the ruddy ridiculous
